item.title: APT - Advanced Package Tool
item.description:
APT (Advanced Package Tool) je softver koji slu≈æi za instalaciju i uklanjanje programa kod Debiana i njegovih derivata (Ubuntu, Mint, MX Linux, Antix i drugi).
Prva APT funkcija koju poƒçetnici prvo nauƒçe je a≈æuriranje baze programa i operativnog sisteme:

  1. A≈æuriranje baze programa, odnosno pretra≈æivanje novih verzija softvera dostupnih za nadogradnju.

    1sudo apt update

  2. A≈æuriranje trenutno instaliranih paketa:

    1sudo apt-get upgrade

  3. A≈æuriranje trenutno instaliranih paketa i instaliranje novih paketa u procesu a≈æuriranja

    1sudo apt upgrade

  4. A≈æuriranje trenutno instaliranih paketa i instaliranje novih paketa u procesu a≈æuriranja kao i uklanjanje paketa koji su pri tome "slomljeni" ('Broken packages' are packages that have unsatisfied dependencies):

    1sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
2sudo apt full-upgrade

Uvek se preporuƒçuje instaliranje programa preko zvaniƒçnih repozitorijuma (neki ih zovu riznice, ja ne mogu - asocira me na 3 ƒáemera blaga):

1sudo apt install vlc

ili u grafiƒçkom okru≈æenju preko Synaptica:

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description:
Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

The emojify function can be called directly in templates or Inline Shortcodes.

To enable emoji globally, set enableEmoji to true in your site's configuration and then you can type emoji shorthand codes directly in content files; e.g.

üôà :see_no_evil: üôâ :hear_no_evil: üôä :speak_no_evil:


The Emoji cheat sheet is a useful reference for emoji shorthand codes.

N.B. The above steps enable Unicode Standard emoji characters and sequences in Hugo, however the rendering of these glyphs depends on the browser and the platform. To style the emoji you can either use a third party emoji font or a font stack; e.g.

1.emoji {
2  font-family: Apple Color Emoji, Segoe UI Emoji, NotoColorEmoji, Segoe UI Symbol, Android Emoji, EmojiSymbols;
3}
